data.title: Fix badly specified RGB10_A2 format
data.body:
There is a bug in RGB10_A2 format for lwjgl implementation - it was specified as RBG instead of RGBA texture. It was causing GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_ATTACHMENT_EXT when trying to use it with MRT.

There might be same problem in other renderers (? jogl, android, ios), I do not compile these projects, so cannot check/fix there - please take a look.

data.title: Support for enabling scissor testing on a per Material basis via RenderState.
data.body:
Added support for enabling GL_SCISSOR_TEST and defining the dimensions of the scissor rectangle by using Material's getAdditionalRenderState(). Forum thread: http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/forum/topic/enabling-and-specifying-scissoring-via-renderstate/

RendererContext now includes renderStateClipRectEnabled along side clipRectEnabled. I also have replaced clipX/clipY/clipW/clipH with a ClipRectangle object and added several new ClipRectangle objects. Their purpose is as follows:

currentClipRect - Contains the dimensions of the clip rectangle currently set with glScissor(). Updates are compared against this to check if a glScissor() call is necessary.
rendererClipRect - Contains the dimensions of the clip rectangle from the last call of setClipRect(). In the event that clipRectEnabled is true and renderStateClipRectEnabled is false currentClipRect should be logically equivalent to this.
renderStateClipRect - Contains the dimensions of the clip rectangle from the last call of applyRenderState assuming that Material.setClipTest() and Material.setClipRect() were true. In the event that clipRectEnabled is false and renderStateClipRectEnabled is true currentClipRect should be logically equivalent to this.
intersectionClipRect - Contains the dimensions of the clip rectangle that is the intersection of both clip rectangles set by setClipRect() and applyRenderState(). In the event that both clipRectEnabled and renderStateClipRectEnabled are true currentClipRect should be logically equivalent to this if the intersection is valid, otherwise it is zeroed.

Some changes to setClipRect() and clearClipRect() were required with the intention that it functions as a master switch. setClipRect() will always result in GL_SCISSOR_TEST being enabled and glScissor/currentClipRect being set to the values entered. clearClipRect() will always result in GL_SCISSOR_TEST being disabled.

data.title: Spatial remove "null" from controls on read(...).
data.body:
It's possible if the class of the control is not found (may be deleted).

In SDK with this modification, the exception about ClassNotFound is "notify"
but it no longer raise a NPE (on clone()) and the j3o can be open and edited
without the missing Control.

data.title: jMonkeyEngine SDK exits as corrupted
data.body:
I am trying to install the SDK for some time now. I have tested Windows 32 and 64 bit on Windows 8.1 native, on Windows 7 VM and Linux 64bit on Arch Linux. These are all on the same machine.

I saw this problem happen to others but have not found a solution.

data.title: DXT compressed textures not working with texture2DArrays
data.body:
Texture2DArrays don't work when filled with dxt compressed textures. It causes geometries to be rendered black or weired colored.

More information about that issue can be found here: http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/forum/topic/dds-not-working-with-texturearrays/

data.title: SDK 3.1-pre-svn JME3 New BasicGame - template with older libraries
data.body: Template BasicGame when creating with current HEAD SDK require older libraries: jme3 and jme3-libraries. Due to fact, that jme3 is split to many partial libraries it has to be updated to core library jme3-core and provide in simple readme in BasicGame method to add more specific libraries.

It can save a bit of space in multiple tabs in tab-group.

data.title: Cleanup .gitignore
data.body:
Maybe i am missing something but perhaps we could cleanup the .gitignore file so instead of the full paths everywhere for the build folder we could just ignore a global build folder `build/`  and if that includes some folder that we do in fact want to keep maybe rename that folder? Because the ignore file has a ridiculous amount of redundant folder names.

I solved this temporarily by catching `Exception` instead

data.title: EOL fix
data.body:
This should be tested thoroughly in case it breaks something.

I did the following;
https://help.github.com/articles/dealing-with-line-endings

```
git rm --cached -r .
# Remove everything from the index.

git reset --hard
# Write both the index and working directory from Git's database.

git add .
# Prepare to make a commit by staging all the files that will get normalized.
# This is your chance to inspect which files were never normalized. You should
# get lots of messages like: "warning: CRLF will be replaced by LF in file."

git commit -m "Normalize all the line endings"
# Commit
```

data.title: Default MTL loader loads fully opaque materials as transparent
data.body:
A minor issue, but a nasty pitfall that can cause hours of debugging.

The default MTL Loader plugin uses the d or the tr option to enable transparency, if detected.

This is done [here](https://github.com/jMonkeyEngine/jmonkeyengine/blob/master/jme3-core/src/plugins/java/com/jme3/scene/plugins/MTLLoader.java#L224).

It says:

``` java
if (tempAlpha != 0){
    alpha = tempAlpha;
    transparent = true;
}
```

The problem is: if alpha is 1.0, then the material is actually _not_ transparent, but is loaded as transparent (because 1.0 != 0).

For instance the default value for opaque materials when exporting MTL files with Blender is 1.0.

That means, the MTL Loader would load any material as transparent and the OBJLoader would [put the geometry into the Transparent Bucket](https://github.com/jMonkeyEngine/jmonkeyengine/blob/master/jme3-core/src/plugins/java/com/jme3/scene/plugins/OBJLoader.java#L422).

This causes problems when transparent objects are close in front of opaque objects - you can then see through both (e.g. a holographic monitor inside a cockpit).

_Possible workarounds:_
- Override MTL Loader (not a good soluation if you want to load the j3o files, the SDK creates for you by using the default MTL Loader)
- Force this setting with your model editor - also not good: might cause the material to be fully transparent in this editor
- Edit the MTL file so that the d or tr parameter reads 0 for opaque materials

_Possible fix:_
Change the code of jmonkey, so that the above lines read...

``` java
if (tempAlpha < 1.f) {
    alpha = tempAlpha;
    transparent = true;
}
```

If you feel this shouldn't be fixed in code, please think about mentioning it in the tutorials / documentation somewhere.

data.body: Turns out the imporved  error dialog was less helpful than the old one...

data.title: Refactor screenshots
data.body:
I have taken the time to refactor the ScreenshotAppState and made the system more extendable.

Key changes:
- Split out the SceneProcessor from the AppState.
- Separate the writeToFile aspect from the SceneProcessor, what happens to the screenshot after it is taken is now pluggable.
- The file writing has support for custom naming schemes.

This is still a bit WIP, but please give me your thoughts.

 I will squash this when it is cooked =)

data.title: Identical WayPoints in Path -> Exception
data.body:
Topic: http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/forum/topic/issue-with-motionpathmotionevent/

hey there, the relevant info can be found in the linked topic, here a
TLDR:
if you have a path of 2 waypoints, and both have the same coodinates a:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 4, Size: 4
at java.util.ArrayList.rangeCheck(ArrayList.java:604)
at java.util.ArrayList.get(ArrayList.java:382)
at com.jme3.math.Spline.interpolate(Spline.java:288)
[...]
is thrown. I think this should be handled differently :)

thanks!
Netsky
